{{Infobox football biography |name = Moses Makasi |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Kusu Moses Makasi{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/465277|title=Squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed|date=1 September 2017|accessdate=18 February 2018|publisher=Premier League}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|9|22|df=y}}{{soccerway|moses-makasi/408156|accessdate=31 January 2018}} |birth_place = |height = {{height|m=1.80}}{{cite web|url=http://www.footballsquads.co.uk/eng/2017-2018/flone/plymouth.htm|title=Plymouth Argyle 2017/2018|accessdate=9 April 2018|publisher=FootballSquads.co.uk}} |position = [[Midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]]
(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) |clubnumber = 24 |youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = |years1 = 2015– |clubs1 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2015 |clubs2 = → [[Chelmsford City F.C.|Chelmsford City]] (loan) |caps2 = 6 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2018 |clubs3 = → [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] (loan) |caps3 = 7 |goals3 = 1 |years4 = 2019– |clubs4 = → [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] (loan) |caps4 = 8 |goals4 = 0 |club-update = 09:52, 3 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Kusu Moses Makasi''' (born 22 September 1995) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]], on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], as a [[midfielder]]. ==Career== Makasi signed his first professional contract with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/teams/development-squad/squad/moses-makasi|title=Profile|accessdate=8 June 2018|publisher=West Ham United F.C.}} He spent time on loan at [[Chelmsford City F.C.|Chelmsford City]] in August and September 2015,{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2015/september/13-september/makasi-enjoying-non-league-experience|title=Makasi enjoying non-league experience|date=13 September 2015|accessdate=14 February 2018|publisher=West Ham United F.C.}} making six league appearances.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelmsfordcityfc.com/teams/62438/player/moses-makasi-1533595/38766|title=Profile|accessdate=16 February 2018|publisher=Chelmsford City F.C.}} He signed a new contract with West Ham in May 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2016/may/17-may/midfielder-makasi-signs-new-contract|title=Midfielder Makasi signs new contract|date=17 May 2016|accessdate=14 February 2018|publisher=West Ham United F.C.}} Makasi began the 2017–18 season as [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the [[West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy|U23 squad]] and scored in the [[EFL Trophy]] win over [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]] in August 2017. He was named on the bench for five first-team matches. In January 2018 he joined [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] on loan for the remainder of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42895042|title=Moses Makasi: Plymouth Argyle sign West Ham United midfielder on loan|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his first team debut on 13 February 2018, in a 4–2 home win against [[AFC Wimbledon]], coming on as a substitute for [[Antoni Sarcevic]]. He scored his first goal for the club in his next game, his first start, in a 1–1 draw away at [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]]. In total Makasi played seven league games for Argyle, scoring once. He returned to West Ham in April for cartilage surgery after a knee injury cut short his loan spell.{{cite web|url=https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/how-midfielder-moses-makasi-played-1488780|title=How Moses Makasi played through injury during his Argyle loan spell|date=23 April 2018|accessdate=8 June 2018|author=Chris Errington|publisher=Plymouth Herald}} In June 2018 he signed a new one-year contract with West Ham.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/june/06-june/midfielder-makasi-pens-new-contract|title=Midfielder Makasi pens new contract|date=6 June 2018|accessdate=8 June 2018|publisher=West Ham United F.C}} Makasi joined League Two club [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] on loan on 11 January 2019, signing for the remainder of the [[2018–19 in English football|2018–19]] season.{{cite news | title = Moses Makasi: Stevenage sign West Ham midfielder on loan | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46840356 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 11 January 2019 | accessdate = 11 January 2019}} ==Personal life== Makasi was born in England and is of Nigerian descent.{{cite web|url=https://guardian.ng/sport/does-the-english-premiership-hold-the-key-to-nigerias-revival/|title=Does the English Premiership hold the key to Nigeria's revival?|date=18 April 2016|accessdate=21 April 2018|author=Christian Okpara|publisher=Nigerian Guardian}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 2 March
